Title: Sumika's Notes - Entry 7
Text:
Day 7 â€“ Cloudy (If what's above my head can still be called "weather.")

When I woke up and checked my watch, I noticed something odd. Moss had started growing beneath the glass. This city, fractured and folded in on itself, seems trapped in some kind of temporal loop. Time moves forward and backward within a fixed range. But oddly enough, the plants don't seem bound by each "reset."

The moss shouldn't be able to grow between the gears... unless time isn't flowing normally here. It's eroding, rushing, and spawning things that shouldn't even exist in the first place.

Still, I'm grateful for this strange, unreasonable growth. It made me realize this city isn't beyond saving. There is a way out.

(The pen seems to pause, leaving a small blot of ink on the paper.)

There's one thing I still can't let go of.

That rift... In my blurred memory, it sealed shut almost as soon as I was pulled into the storm. But if I can't figure out what caused it, or how to stop it. There's no way to guarantee it won't open again. And if it does... someone else could get dragged in.

However, time's against me.
